page.title: 01LAMBLEY AND WOODBOROUGH
page.content: Our grid square is located just north east of Nottingham.It covers the Green belt,so very few new buildings can be built.This is because the Green belt is protected land.The two villages of {Lambley}and{Woodborough}are in the square.The services offered are shops, pubs and a bus service.Part of Arnold is also in our square.Both Lambley and Woodborough are in valleys,and have quaint,picturesque houses plus some modern ones.Footpaths lead from Lambley to Woodborough,and go through some rolling scenery.The villages offer few leisure opportunities.This is the commuter zone for Nottingham. This is where people go into town in the mornings.There are isolated farms,and crops are grown.The lanes in our square are narrow,and quite hilly. The area has a certain rurality.
